pages.text: Platycaraspis was a jawless fish from the Silurian with a very unique headshield. Like other galeaspids, which all had weird looking headshields, Platycaraspis also had a hole on the top of its head, which was not its actual mouth. It probably was an active swimmer, and searched for food on the seafloor.
